Question: How consistent is your brand’s core message and visuals across all your channels?
Relevant Channel: Email List, Events/Webinars, Paid Ads, Partnership/Referral, Social Media, Website
Option 1: Each channel has its own voice; there's little consistency
Option 2: We try to align our messaging, but inconsistencies slip through
Option 3: We have a unified voice and style, but some channels are less refined
Option 4: Our brand voice and message are flawlessly consistent across all platforms

Question: How do you track the performance of your marketing across all channels?
Relevant Channel: Email List, Events/Webinars, Paid Ads, Partnership/Referral, Social Media, Website
Option 1: We don’t track much beyond basic metrics
Option 2: We use analytics per channel, but lack unified reporting
Option 3: We track KPIs and review performance monthly
Option 4: We have a dashboard tracking ROI across all channels and adjust accordingly

Question: How often do you audit or optimize your marketing materials and assets?
Relevant Channel: Email List, Events/Webinars, Paid Ads, Partnership/Referral, Social Media, Website
Option 1: Rarely or never—we use the same assets for years
Option 2: We update things occasionally, usually when something breaks
Option 3: We review and refresh assets every quarter or so
Option 4: We proactively audit, update, and A/B test creative across all channels

Question: How well are your marketing efforts aligned with your sales or client onboarding process?
Relevant Channel: Email List, Events/Webinars, Paid Ads, Partnership/Referral, Social Media, Website
Option 1: Marketing and sales function completely separately
Option 2: There’s minimal coordination between marketing and sales
Option 3: We have shared goals, but integration could be better
Option 4: Marketing and sales are tightly aligned, with shared tools and feedback loops

Question: How frequently do you post on your social media platforms?
Option 1: We post sporadically, sometimes weeks go by without content.
Option 2: We post about once a week, but without a consistent schedule.
Option 3: We post 3–4 times per week with some strategic planning.
Option 4: We post daily with a clear content calendar aligned to goals.

Question: How well do you engage with your audience through comments, messages, and reactions?
Option 1: We rarely respond to comments or DMs.
Option 2: We reply occasionally, mostly to direct questions.
Option 3: We actively reply to comments and messages when tagged or mentioned.
Option 4: We initiate conversations, reply to most interactions, and engage in real-time.

Question: How often do you run campaigns, contests, or interactive content?
Relevant Channel: Email List, Paid Ads, Social Media
Option 1: We’ve never run any kind of campaign or interactive post.
Option 2: Occasionally, but only for major promotions.
Option 3: We run light campaigns or engagement content quarterly.
Option 4: We regularly use campaigns, polls, and interactive content to drive engagement.

Question: Do you collaborate with influencers or partners on social media?
Option 1: We’ve never worked with influencers or collaborators.
Option 2: We’ve done a few one-off collaborations, without much planning.
Option 3: We work with relevant partners occasionally to extend our reach.
Option 4: We have an ongoing influencer/partner strategy with strong alignment.

Question: How do you handle negative feedback or complaints?
Relevant Channel: Email List, Events/Webinars, Paid Ads, Partnership/Referral, Social Media, Website
Option 1: We usually ignore or delete negative comments.
Option 2: We occasionally respond but without a clear protocol.
Option 3: We try to respond calmly and redirect issues privately.
Option 4: We have a defined response strategy that turns issues into trust-builders.

Question: What role does user-generated content (UGC) play in your social media strategy?
Option 1: We don’t encourage or use UGC.
Option 2: Occasionally we repost a customer’s photo or comment.
Option 3: We have informal ways to showcase customer content.
Option 4: We actively encourage, feature, and reward UGC in our strategy.

Question: How do you use storytelling in your social media content?
Option 1: We don’t use storytelling — our posts are mostly announcements.
Option 2: We occasionally share behind-the-scenes or longer captions.
Option 3: We use storytelling elements like customer journeys or brand values.
Option 4: Storytelling is central to our content, creating emotional connection.

Question: How intentional are you about content that supports customer retention?
Option 1: We focus mostly on acquiring new followers/customers.
Option 2: We occasionally share loyalty content but it’s not consistent.
Option 3: We post retention content like tips, updates, or user spotlights.
Option 4: We have a retention-focused content plan with series, rewards, and personalization.

Question: How well does your content reflect the needs and interests of your target audience?
Relevant Channel: Email List, Paid Ads, Social Media, Website
Option 1: We mostly post what we want to say, not what our audience wants.
Option 2: We have a general idea of what our audience likes, but no data to guide us.
Option 3: We use some data and feedback to guide content decisions.
Option 4: Content is deeply audience-informed via analytics, surveys, and testing.

Question: How well does your website communicate your core value proposition to a first-time visitor?
Option 1: It's not clear what we offer or who it's for.
Option 2: It's somewhat clear but could be more concise or visually emphasized.
Option 3: Our value proposition is visible and clear, though may not grab attention immediately.
Option 4: Visitors immediately understand what we do and why it matters.

Question: How well does your website convert visitors into leads or customers?
Option 1: We don’t track conversions or have no clear paths to conversion
Option 2: We have some calls to action, but few conversions
Option 3: Conversion paths exist and perform decently
Option 4: We actively optimize conversion funnels with strong CTAs and data insights

Question: How well is your website optimized for user experience (navigation, load speed, mobile-friendliness)?
Option 1: It's slow, hard to navigate, or not mobile-friendly
Option 2: It works, but some areas are clunky or inconsistent
Option 3: It’s generally smooth and mobile-friendly
Option 4: It’s intuitive, fast, and optimized across all devices

Question: Does your website support your customer service or self-service needs?
Option 1: No — customers must contact us for any help
Option 2: There’s basic help info but it’s limited
Option 3: Includes a help page, FAQ, or contact options
Option 4: Full support resources like live chat, help center, or knowledge base

Question: What types of content formats do you use on social media?
Option 1: Mostly static posts or text updates
Option 2: Mix of posts and stories
Option 3: We use video, carousels, stories, and lives
Option 4: We use a diverse content mix optimized for each platform and algorithm

Question: Does your website include trust-building elements (e.g., testimonials, case studies, certifications, guarantees)?
Option 1: None at all. We haven't included trust elements.
Option 2: One or two basic elements, like a testimonial.
Option 3: We include a few forms of social proof or credentials.
Option 4: Multiple strong forms of trust signals are woven throughout the site.

Question: How often do you send emails to your list?
Option 1: We haven’t emailed them in months — maybe longer.
Option 2: We send emails sporadically when we have something to promote.
Option 3: We have a regular schedule and provide a mix of content and offers.
Option 4: We have a well-structured content calendar with tested timing and cadence.

Question: How do people typically join your email list?
Option 1: We don’t really have a system—people join randomly or are added manually.
Option 2: Mostly through a generic opt-in form on our site, without any incentive.
Option 3: Through targeted opt-ins tied to content or offers (e.g., lead magnets).
Option 4: Through optimized, multi-touch campaigns with specific acquisition funnels.

Question: How well do you segment your email list?
Option 1: We don’t segment our list at all—everyone gets the same emails.
Option 2: We segment by basic demographics or user type (e.g., new vs. existing).
Option 3: We use behavior-based segmentation (e.g., click history, product interest).
Option 4: We use dynamic segmentation, tagging, and automations for real-time personalization.

Question: How do you handle unsubscribes and inactive subscribers?
Option 1: We don’t monitor or clean the list.
Option 2: We occasionally clean the list manually.
Option 3: We regularly remove inactives and monitor unsubscribe trends.
Option 4: We have automated list hygiene protocols and re-engagement campaigns.

Question: How does email fit into your broader marketing strategy?
Option 1: We use email in isolation with no connection to other goals.
Option 2: Email is used to support promotions but not tied to a strategy.
Option 3: Email supports specific campaigns and sales goals.
Option 4: Email is a key component in a multi-touch, long-term marketing strategy.

Question: What best describes your ad creative testing process?
Option 1: We rarely test creatives — it’s mostly guesswork
Option 2: We test occasionally but without a structured process
Option 3: We routinely A/B test headlines and visuals
Option 4: We run continuous, data-informed tests across all elements and optimize based on clear KPIs

Question: How well does your advertising build trust with your target audience?
Option 1: Our ads make big claims without social proof or transparency
Option 2: We use persuasive language, but little validation or trust elements
Option 3: Our ads include testimonials or brand credentials
Option 4: We consistently integrate trust-building elements like guarantees, case studies, and credibility markers

Question: How aligned are your ad offers with what your audience actually wants?
Option 1: We mostly guess what offers will work
Option 2: We base offers on trends or competitors
Option 3: We use audience feedback and past performance to guide offers
Option 4: Our offers are validated through data, regularly refreshed, and drive high click and conversion rates

Question: How well do your paid ads integrate with your overall marketing funnel?
Option 1: Our ads exist in isolation with no connection to a broader funnel
Option 2: Ads lead to landing pages, but there’s little follow-up
Option 3: Ads are designed to guide users into a conversion path
Option 4: Our ad strategy is deeply integrated into a multistep funnel that nurtures leads and drives lifetime value

Question: How often do returning customers or leads re-engage with your paid ads?
Option 1: We have no way of tracking or encouraging re-engagement
Option 2: Some returning users engage, but not by design
Option 3: We run occasional retargeting or loyalty ads
Option 4: We have a dedicated re-engagement strategy with dynamic retargeting and loyalty incentives

Question: How do you typically promote your events or webinars?
Option 1: We mostly rely on word-of-mouth or last-minute promotions.
Option 2: We share our events on a few internal channels, but promotion is inconsistent.
Option 3: We have a solid promotion plan using email and social media weeks in advance.
Option 4: We follow a strategic, multi-channel campaign with audience segmentation and timelines.

Question: How do you determine the topics or themes for your events?
Option 1: We decide based on what we think is interesting — without audience input.
Option 2: We sometimes consider feedback, but it’s mostly guesswork.
Option 3: We use past event feedback or industry trends to guide us.
Option 4: We actively research, survey our audience, and test topics before planning.

Question: How strong is your follow-up process after an event?
Option 1: We don’t follow up at all after events.
Option 2: We send one generic thank-you email, but nothing more.
Option 3: We send personalized follow-up emails and links to replays or resources.
Option 4: We use segmentation to deliver targeted follow-ups, CTAs, and nurture sequences.

Question: How do you capture leads during your events?
Option 1: We don’t have any lead capture process.
Option 2: We collect names and emails, but rarely use the data.
Option 3: We gather detailed attendee info and add it to our CRM or email list.
Option 4: We have automated lead capture with tagging, scoring, and workflows.

Question: Do you feature external experts or partners in your events to boost credibility?
Option 1: No, we only use internal speakers or team members.
Option 2: We occasionally invite guests, but it's not part of a strategy.
Option 3: We bring in experts to co-host or contribute to key sessions.
Option 4: We strategically co-host events with influencers, partners, or top-tier experts to elevate our brand.

Question: How consistently do your referral partners send new leads your way?
Option 1: Rarely — most partnerships are inactive.
Option 2: Occasionally — we receive leads inconsistently.
Option 3: Often — a few partners reliably send us leads.
Option 4: Regularly — most partners actively send qualified leads.

Question: How do you incentivize or reward your referral partners?
Option 1: We don’t have any reward or incentive structure in place.
Option 2: We occasionally offer informal rewards or gifts.
Option 3: We have a clear system in place, but it’s underutilized.
Option 4: We offer strong, consistent rewards that keep partners motivated.

Question: How frequently do you communicate with your referral partners?
Option 1: Rarely — we haven’t reached out in a while.
Option 2: Occasionally — only when there’s a reason.
Option 3: Monthly or quarterly — with helpful updates.
Option 4: Frequently — we stay top of mind with engaging, two-way communication.

Question: How trackable are the results of your referral efforts?
Option 1: We don’t track referral sources or performance at all.
Option 2: We have some visibility, but it’s inconsistent.
Option 3: We track most referrals and review outcomes periodically.
Option 4: We rigorously track, analyze, and optimize referral performance.

Question: How do you stay top-of-mind with your partners in-between referrals?
Option 1: We don’t — they often forget about us.
Option 2: We occasionally check in, but it’s sporadic.
Option 3: We send regular updates and touchpoints.
Option 4: We actively build relationships with valuable, consistent outreach.

Question: How well do your social media profiles drive traffic to your website?
Option 1: We rarely include website links on our social posts.
Option 2: We sometimes link to our homepage or blog, but not consistently.
Option 3: We regularly link to relevant website pages in posts and stories.
Option 4: We use strategic link placement, UTM tracking, and optimize content to drive high-converting traffic to targeted pages.

Question: How do you capture leads or inquiries through your website and social media?
Option 1: We don't have any forms, lead magnets, or inquiry CTAs.
Option 2: We have a basic contact form, but it's not actively promoted.
Option 3: We offer a lead magnet or gated content, promoted via posts and on our site.
Option 4: We run cross-channel lead generation campaigns with optimized landing pages, forms, and track conversions.
